result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew James Bohringer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.
  • Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: - Pay restitution in the following amounts:  $2,367.00 payable to US Bank, $2,620.00 payable to Tri-City National Bank, $751.00 payable to TCF Bank.  Restitution to be collected by DOC from the defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account; an amount or percentage which the department determines is reasonable for restitution to victims; balance to be paid during extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

EACH COUNT: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA, to be collected by DOC from defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account; an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable; balance to be paid during extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: consecutive to Count 3, credit for 592 days time served.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew James Bohringer

records.addlTxt: Per Remittitur dated, December 14, 2018, Appeal No. 2017AP002034 CRNM, IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on October 30, 2018, that:  IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of conviction is summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Erickson is relieved of further representation of Bohringer in this matter.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).
records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order affirming

records.addlTxt: per order dated October 30, 2018, Appeal No. 2017AP2034-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of conviction is summarily affirmed. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Erickson is relieved of further representation of Bohringer in this matter. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32(3). IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.

Per Order Dated November 28, 2017, Appeal No. 2017AP2036-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED that by December 8, 2017, counsel for Matthew James Bohringer shall file with the clerk of the circuit court an amended notice of appeal. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that if the amended notice of appeal is filed, the requirement of WIS. STAT. RULE 809.11(2) of transmittal of the notice and circuit court record of the case is waived; it is only necessary for the clerk of the circuit court to forward the amended notice of appeal to this court by supplemental record return within five days of its filing.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew James Bohringer in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant Matthew James Bohringer in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. 

As to Count 1:  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 9 years and 6 months, consecutive to Count 3, credit for 592 days time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 3 years and 6 months, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 6 years. 

As to Count 3:  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 9 years and 6 months, consecutive to Count 1, credit for 592 days time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 3 years and 6 months, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 6 years. 

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
- DNA sample. 
- Pay restitution in the following amounts:  $2,367.00 payable to US Bank, $2,620.00 payable to Tri-City National Bank, $751.00 payable to TCF Bank.  Restitution to be collected by DOC from the defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account; an amount or percentage which the department determines is reasonable for restitution to victims; balance to be paid during extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
- Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA, to be collected by DOC from defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account; an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable; balance to be paid during extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Attorney Matt Last in court, defendant Matthew James Bohringer not in court, in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for sentencing hearing.  Court is in trial with another matter.  Paties request an adjourned date.  Neither party wishes to address the court on the record. Case adjourned to Branch 18.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew James Bohringer in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant Matthew James Bohringer in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED but read-in for sentencing purposes.  

As to Counts 1 and 3:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 18.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
ADA Ballenger and attorney Last contacted court to set case for projected guilty plea. Case scheduled for plea hearing on 12-08-2016 at 1:30 pm.

Defendant Matthew James Bohringer in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant Matthew James Bohringer in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Matter in court for Motion hearing. Defense motions the Court to adjourn the September 12, 2016 Jury Trial. No objections by the State. The September 12, 2016 Jury trial is vacated. Jury trial adjourned to December 12, 2016 at 9:00 before Judge Pedro Colon.
